WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder.window

Function/Meaning
Window size
Type
Property of WaveSoundBuffer.PhaseVocoder class (Read/Write)
Description
Represents the window size (frame size) of the FFT (Fast Fourier Transform) used internally by PhaseVocoder. Specify a power of 2 between 64 and 32768. The default is 4096.
Increasing this value improves resolution in the frequency domain (pitch becomes more accurate), but decreases resolution in the time domain (sound attacks become duller).
Increasing the value will use more CPU. Find the lowest value that maintains acceptable sound quality.
For 44.1KHz voice, a window size of around 256 is recommended. For music, a window size of around 4096 is recommended.
Changes to this property are applied when the WaveSoundBuffer.open method is executed.
